description: This refers to an employee who is engaged in accounting duties, handling and receipting money under supervision.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for taking care of doctors' appointments and maintains all clinical records.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for processing the admission of patients in a hospital and handles cash paid by patients or relatives and allocates beds in a ward, files and deals with confidential matters concerning patients
This refers to an employee who issues invoices/bills to patients for items used during procedures or on discharge from the hospital.
This refers to an employee who oversees and manages the daily operations of a medical facility or clinic.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for receiving statements and arranging the payments of creditors
This refers to an employee who is responsible for feeding or punching information into a computer.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for receiving, checking and posting of creditors or debtors invoices, makes payments and reconciling statements, prepares adjustments on journals and ensures monthly deadlines are met.
This refers to an employee who helps compile and maintain employee records for the organisation.
This refers to an employee who, under supervision cleans floors, equipment, collects and records laboratory samples.
This refers to an employee who manages, organizes and directs day to day operations of the organization.
This refers to an employee who provides administrative support for the efficient and effective implemenatation of project activities.

This refers to an employee whose duties include the receiving of visitors, making appointment sna other general office duties and in the case of an employee solely as a typist, typing at aspeed of not less than 35 words a minute.
This refers to an employee who provides records management and filing services.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for processing salaries, wages and statutory payments accurately and timeously under supervision.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for handling cash registers, providing customer service and maintaining cleanliness and order in the shop.

This refers to an employee with appropriate formal training engaged in the carrying oout of such secretarial functions as taking minutes, calling meetinfs, preparing agendas, keeping of records and other such duties.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the work of an accounts clerk who is engaged in accounting duties, handling and receipting money.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for the works admissions clerk, admission of patients, cash payment handling, bed allocation, filing, typing, e-mailing and faxing as well as handling patient's queries professionally and confidentially.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for the work of billing clerk and processes, checks and updates all accounts/bills/invoices of a patient in a hospital and sends them to appropriate medical aid societies where applicable.
This refers to an employee who is employed to remove unwanted plants on the property by spraying and by hand.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for carrying out numerous gardening duties requiring a minimum amount of supervision, soil cultivation, digging, forking, mulching, watering, raking, weeding, edging, pruning, bed preparation and planting. Lawn maintenance and cultivation. The use and maintenance of hand tools and basic light machinery.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for the general maintenance of the grounds and garden at the school. Main duties are to carry out numerous gardening duties, requiring a minimum amount of supervision. Soil cultivation, digging, forking, mulching, watering, raking, weeding, edging, pruning, bed preparation and planting. Lawn maintenance and cultivation. The use and maintenance of hand tools and basic light machinery.

qualifications: O’ Levels Science; water ops cert (adv.)
description: This refers to an employee who is responsible for the maintenance and servicing of pumping equipment under supervision.

This refers to an employees who, under supervision is responsible for the care and welfare of residents in an institution and for general cleanliness, hygiene and the supervision of staff and the smooth running of the institution who deputizes the housekeeper.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for cleaning offices, windows and sweeping floors of grounds daily.

This refers to an employee with formal training or appropriate experience, who is responsible for the care and welfare of residents in an institution and for general cleanliness, hygiene and the supervision os staff and the smooth running of the institution.
This refers to an employee who is specifically engaged in the conveying or delivery of letters, parcels or messages on foot or by bicycles and includes the making of tea or similar beverages.
This refers to an employee engaged wholly or substantially in delivering messages on foot or by bicycle or tricycle and whose duties may include deliveries to and from a bank.
This refers to an employee who is engaged in keeping a library in good order and who carries out cleaning and general library duties as directed by the librarian.

This refers to an employee with formal training or appropriate experience engaged in cataloguing, classification of books filing and keeping the library and its collection of books and materials in good order, under supervision.
This refers to an employee who provides training services to the organisation.
This refers to an employee who provides assistance to librarians in library and research service and maintains the library and its collections.

This refers to an employee with formal training or appropriate experience responsible for all aspects of library administration, classification cataloguing, filing, book selection and acquisition as wellas the supervision of the other library personnel.

titles: Nursery School Teacher (Ministry Of Education Trained)
description: This refers to an employee who has been certified by the Ministry of Education after successful completion of a three year course of training.
This refers to an employee with no special qualifications but who is capable fo conducting educational programs or classes at such an institution.
This refers to an employee who is trained by an NGO for one year or more and recommended by the Ministry of Education.
This refers to an employee who has been trained by Nursery School Teachers Association and recommended by the Ministry of Education.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for religious teaching and counseling.

This refers to an employee who holds a diploma in education and is qualified to teach and educate students according to guidelines provided by the national curriculum framework under the overall guidance of the Ministry of Education.
This refers to an employee who possesses at least 5 O' Levels who is engaged to teach students in a school or college.
This refers to an employee who assists in the accounting operations under the supervision of an Accountant.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for professional handling of all finances for educational institutions, submitting returns and the preparation of all books for audit.

This refers to an employee who is engaged in the operation and manitenance of boilers which produce steam, including monitoring of high pressures and temperatures in accordance with safety requirements.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for caring and attending to the daily needs of poultry and livestock and carries out other related duties.
This refers to an employee whose duties include the receiving and distribution of fuel.
This means, without in any way limiting the generality of this definition, an employee who carries out unskilled work either indoors or outdoors, under supervision.
This refers to an employee who is enegaged in the cleaning, feeding and dipping of the animals under care.

This refers to an employee who is engaged in carrying out repairs without supervision; directing and controlling the work of caretakers and handyperson, routine maintenance of buildings and equipment and the preparation and compliance with maintenance schedule as may be required.
This refers to an employee who is engaged in the general maintenance of a swimming pool and its surroundings, including the pumping and checking of the water level.

This refers to an employee who is engaged in the general maintenance of a swimming pool and its surroundings. His or her duties include the pumping and checking of water levekesm as well as the control, monitoring and recording of the quality of the swimming pool water by the addition of solid, liquid, or gaseous chemicals and the carrying out of simple water analysis tests.
This refers to an employees who is responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of tennis courts.
This refers to an employee who is engaged in the checking of water in tanks and ensuring that appropriate levels are maintained at all times, as well as carryiny out other related duties.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for running the company premises or clinic and is responsible for treatment of the sick and gives advice to both workers and management on hea;th issues, including safety awareness and those employed in the hospitals to provide quality general nursing care to patients as well as to check and restock emergency drugs and equipment.
This refers to an employee who is trained and registered with the Health Professions Council who is trained to give care and administer treatment to patients at a clinic or hosptial.

This refers to an employee who provides leadershi in facilitating and ensuring integration and implementat of health services, water and sanitation, nutrition, HIV/AIDS, food security using the integrated programming model.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the general cleanliness of residents' rooms and for the general care of residents.
This refers to an employee who is engaged in assisting with nursing procedures under supervision, including feeding patients, cleaning wards and performing other functions as required.
This refers to an employee with no special qualifications who assists nursery school teachers but does not conduct any educational programs of a nursery school or class.
This refers to an employee who provides nursing care as delegated and supervises the work of junio nurse aides and cleaners.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for supporting the Vet and ensures the welfare and comfort of all hospital patients.
This refers to an employee who assists in the preparation of meals, under supervision, and is capable of acting as a cook when necessary.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for planning, coordinating and controlling all catering activities and supervising all catering staff.
This refers to an employee who is engaged in the preparation of meals following written instructions, coordinating other kitchen activities and the supervision of junior staff.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for controlling at least three cooks and is fully conversant with all aspects of the preparation and serving of meals, stock control, diets, and ordering of supplies.
This refers to an employee whose duties include the recording of all foodstuffs into cold-rooms, pantries and or storerooms and is responsible for issuing the imes concerned.
This refers to an employee who generally cleans kitchenware and the kitchen and or dining room.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the preparation of meals, the purchasing of supplie, and the control of kitchen staff and who carries out duties as supervisor.
This refers to an employee who supervises other waiters in all their duties and is in charge of the cutlery and linen.

This refers to an employee who carries out general cleaning of theatre instruments and trolley and sluicing of linen, collecting and returning of patients to the wards after patients in the theatre and recovery room, and taking care and collecting dispensary baskets.

This refers to an employee who is engaged wholly or substantially in serving meals or drinks, inside or outside the dining rooms/s of the establishment, and who assists in the preparation and cleaning of the dining room and kitchen and associated equipment and utensils.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for teaching computers to students under supervision.
This refers to an employee who performs laboratory work without direct supervision but reports to a senior laboratory technicians.

This refers to an employee who has successfully completed a recognized laboratory technician's course and carries out work in a laboratory without direct supervision e.g. H.N.D in Chemistry or Microbiology.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for repairing and maintaining vehicle engines and other machinery who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker III in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].

This refers to an employee who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class III in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02], who maintains and improves the overall condition and safety of all vehicles by ensuring high quality workmanship, regular vehicle servicing and supervision of vehicle maintenance.

description: This refers to an employee who is responsible for the provision of institutional ambulance services to clients.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for restoring function to maximum level after injury or disability of a patient that is whether it is permanent or temporal, mental or physical active and educates people on the prevention of disabilities or injuries.

This refers to an employee who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class I in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02], who maintains and improves the overall condition and safety of all vehicles by ensuring high quality workmanship, regular vehicle servicing and supervision of vehicle maintenance.

This refers to an employee who manages and administers fuel, procurement, transport and maintenance and security
This refers to an employee with appropriate experience who is responsible for the supervision of lower staff in any department of an institution as directed by employer.

qualifications: Diploma Degree relevant field; driver’s license
description: This refers to an employee who provides effective community mobilisation, carries out needs assessment, training and provides project selection and extension services during project implementation in given areas.
This refers to an employee who deputizes the Cleaning Supervisor in supervising all general workers employed by an organization to carry out cleaning and grounds maintenance work.
This refers to an employee who deputizes for the supervisor in all aspects of supervision.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for receipting of drungs bougt over the counter, food supplied, telephone bills etc. and all debtors payments, then processes the retail accounts and follow up R.D cheques while preparing banking on a daily basis.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for supervising all general workers employed by an organization to carry out cleaning and ground maintenance duties

This refers to an employee who is responsible for ensuring that the warehouse has proper accounting and reporting systems in place to effectively support management decisions in accordance with donar requirements.

This refers to an employee who assists the Program Manager with the design and application of sound M & E systems and is also tasked with facilitating the design of relevant data collection tools for periodic, baseline, outcome and impact evaluation studies and the effective administration of the same.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for providing effective project management implementation and training support to the organization on all emergency and special projects.
This refers to an employee who facilitates the implementation of all programs in the area of operation according to donor standards and guidelines.
This refers to an employee who contributes to the goals and objectives of the Organization by facilitating implementation of the Positive Development Programs.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for growing, harvesting and processing of herbs and offers training to other organizations.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for the support and maintenance of the day to day operations of an organisation's management informations systems through the provision of a client oriented service that focuses on the support of field staff and the implementation of innovative solutions that automate business processes and informed decision making.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for administering, calculating and issuing payroll to employees.

This refers to an employee who identifies and keeps an up-to-date list of potential donors both local and foreign.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for community mobilisation, selection and training of health promotors and community and school health club facilitators and monitorring the applied aspect of health club learning.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the day to day safe and efficient operations of the workshop and who supervises and or train junior staff.

This refers to an employee who provides carpentry services to the organization who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class IV in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].
This refers to an employee who is responsible for receiving incoming cash, recipting and banking.
This refers to an employee with no special qualifications who assists special school teachers, but who does not conduct any educational programs in a special care class or school.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for ensuring that patients' information is correct and accurate and gives correct notes for the doctor and also advises patients on issues of nutrition, and health.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for making and bending frames.

This refers to an employee who contributes to the goals and objectives of the organization by facilitating the implementation and management of all Positive and Development Projects in gender and advocacy.
This refers to an employee who assists in administrative support on fuel, procurement and security.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for weaving baskets and chairs and supervises junior cane weavers.
This refers to an employee who is engaged in the operation of a telephone switchboard.
This refers to an employee who provides upholstery services to the institution.
This refers to an employee engaged in the inspection and well-being of animals.

This refers to an employee who generally maintains the cleanliness of an art room and assists in the preparation of all forms of art and craft material, including the mixing of paints, washing of brushes and other items under supervision.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for assisting the builder with any building and masonry work. The employee assists in carrying out general maintenance and repairs as well as construction of new brick/mortar structures as directed.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for assisting the carpenter in carrying out any carpentry work. The employee assists the carpenter to carry out general maintenance and repairs as well as construction of simple wooden structures as directed. The incumbent assists in carrying out carpentry work on institutions property such as doors, chairs, desks, tables as well as roofing and ceiling.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for assisting the painter with any paintwork. The employee assists in the painting of any old or new building and any other paint work as instructed.
This refers to an employee who is fully conversant with and mainly engaged in the preparation of different confectionaries, but may also be involved in the prepartion of other foods.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the conduct, discipline and welfare of student in a boarding school.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the binding of books, including the operation of binding machinery and ensuring quality standards are met.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, including processing transactions and reconciling accounts.
This refers to an employee who operates and maintains a brush cutting machine, cutting grass and weeds on the grounds, pathways and fence lines.

This refers to an employee who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skilled worker Class I in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02]. They are responsible for overseeing construction projects, ensuring they are completed on time and to specifications.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for making detergents.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for contributing to the accurate targeting for feeding programs primarily through verification of registered beneficiaries and non-beneficiaries and or complaints.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for making fences.
This refers to an employee who erects and maintains fences as per requirement. These include electric, plain wire and pole fences.

This refers to an employee who monitors and supervises the day to day distributions of food within the school and solves problems encountered during the operations. He or she will foster good relations with local rural districts officials, school heads and teachers in charge of the program in the schools to facilitate the smooth implementation of the feeding program in the district.

This refers to an employee who is engaged in the washing and ironing by hand of articles of clothing or linen, which are normally subject to the process of laundering.

This refers to an employee who is employed on mechanical, electrical or carpentry work, boiler maintenance, welding, painting, repairs and renovations of minor nature to his employer's property, who works under supervision who has undergone a course of instruction form a vocational training institution, government polytechnic college or any registered training institution but does not possess a skilled worker's certificate and is not required to embark upon or carry out any task in occupations prescribed for trade designated or deemed to have been.

This refers to an employee who assists the Warehouse supervisor in the management of records, inspection of trucks, stacking of commodities, receiving and dispatching of commodities.

This refers to an employee who is responsible for repairing and maintaining any mechanical equipment within the organisation by welding who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skiller worker Class I in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].

This refers to an employee who is responsible for repairing and maintaining any mechanical equipment within the organisation by welding who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skiller worker Class II in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].

This refers to an employee who is responsible for repairing and maintaining any mechanical equipment within the organisation by welding who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skiller worker Class III in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].

This refers to an employee who is responsible for repairing and maintaining any mechanical equipment within the organisation by welding who has been certified by the Registrar of Apprenticeship and Skilled Manpower as a skiller worker Class IV in terms of the Manpower Planning and Development Act [Chapter 28:02].
This refers to an employee who is responsible for coordinating all the activities relating to youth and children in an organisation.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for enforcing company security regulations, organizes trains, supervises and administers company internal security force.

This refers to an employee who carries out routine patrol work and or gate control duties to assist in the protection of the organisation's premises and the checking of personnel and goods in and out of the organisation.

qualifications: Class 2/4 license; defensive driving; first aid

description: This refers to an employee who is employed primarily to drive an omnibus and who is in possession of a class 1 driver's licence.
This refers to an employee who is employed primarily to drive heavy-duty vehicles except those that carry passengers (omnibuses) and who is in possession of a class 2 driver's licence.
This refers to an employee whose duties include the driving of a motorbike or a scooter and who is in possession of a class 3 driver's licence.
This refers to an employee whose duties include the driving of light motor vehicles and who is in possession of a class 4 driver's licence.
This refers to an employee who is responsible for the transportation of staff and goods and maintenance of vehicles and supervises other drivers.
This refers to an employee whose duties are primarily to drive a tractor, but who is not in possession of a class 5 driver's licence.
This refers to an employee whose duties are primarily to drive a tractor, but who is in possession of a class 5 driver's licence.
